attributes.action: Protect the RNLI from paying licence fees for using Maritime radio frequencies.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: As reported in the Sunday Telegraph on the 28th September 2008, Ofcom wants to bring "market forces" into the maritime and aviation communications. The RNLI will have to pay £250,000 a year, and "smaller search and rescue charities fear they may have to close". This proposal must be rejected wholeheartedly.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Protect the RNLI from paying licence fees for using Maritime radio frequencies."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page17368


Prime Minister's Office
